item.title: How to be online
item.description: ðŸŒ± Seed. Contemplation on how I wish to orchestrate my online existence. Surround yourself with what you aspire to become. Get off social media, unless it’s nourishing.

item.title: How to learn
item.description: ðŸŒ± Seed. Contemplation on how I want to learn. Write down unfamiliar concepts. Create a map of connections, rather than a linear story.

item.title: How to make writing spiritual
item.description: ðŸŒ± Seed. Work-in-progress note where I try to get closer to my goal of experiencing writing and note-taking as part of my spiritual practice.

item.title: How to read
item.description: ðŸŒ± Seed. Contemplation on how I want to read. Nonfiction: Learn to skim, connect what you’re reading with what you already know, ask questions, make notes of what you will actually want to come back to.

item.title: Notes on Getting Things Done
item.description: Notes based on the Blinkist version of Getting Thing Done by David Allen Five steps in the GTD process Capture your thoughts in external collection tools that you routinely empty.

item.title: How to create
item.description: ðŸŒ± Seed. Wondering what approach I should take to being creative. [[notes/Becoming an artist is easier than you think|Become an artist in your everyday life.

item.title: Becoming an artist is easier than you think
item.description: ðŸŒ± Seed. Early version of an essay. My time is split between hard sciences and art of all kinds. I’m a computer science major, software engineer, tech lead, whatever - and in my spare time I sing, play multiple instruments, draw and paint and do calligraphy, act in improv groups and musicals, dance in blues and fusion parties, write prose and poetry, and design knits and interiors.

item.title: How to help with aligning AI
item.description: Nonlinear’s list of resources How to pursue a career in technical AI alignment by Charlie Rogers-Smith AI safety ideas To learn more about [[notes/Why aligning AI matters|why AI alignment matters]], check out the AGI Safety Fundamentals course by EA Cambridge.

item.title: Why 'aligning' AI matters
item.description: Humans are smart, machines could be even smarter, super-smart machines means big changes, and those changes might not be good.

item.title: Inadequacy
item.description: “I am completely inept and inadequate at all the things I’m trying to do.” That’s a thought I had a few days ago.

item.title: Digital gardens
item.description: I recently came across a bunch of websites doing something interesting: People are sharing their personal notes (often Obsidian vaults), or a curated collection of them, publicly on the internet, on their own websites.
